pullrequest.title: Switch to six independent GPS sensor noise models

content.raw:
Oh, I think I meant that the enum's were a good idea, but `std::map<int,NoisePtr>` is very close to a `std::vector<NoisePtr>` since they can both be indexed by an integer. The enums could still be used with a `vector`, using the [at operator](http://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/container/vector/at) to provide bounds checking.

How does it sound to revert to `std::vector<NoisePtr>` but provide the enums?
